title: South Africa pile on the pain for Italy after Andrea Lovotti’s red card
text:
• Italian prop sent off for blatant tip tackle just after half-time • Wing Cheslin Kolbe scores two tries for rampant Springboks

South Africa ramped up the physicality to crush an Italy side reduced to 14 men for most of the second half 49-3 on Friday, moving above the Italians and New Zealand to the top of Pool B in the process.

South Africa v Italy: Rugby World Cup 2019 – live! Read more

The Springboks have never failed to reach the quarter-finals of the World Cup and they all but ensured that run would continue with a display of controlled brutality at Shizuoka Stadium.

The ever-dangerous Cheslin Kolbe scored a try in each half and Bongi Mbonambi, Lukhanyo , Makazole Mapimpi, RG Snyman and Malcolm Marx also crossed to comfortably earn the double World Cup winners a bonus point.

Italy’s already tricky task became nigh on impossible when they had the prop Andrea Lovotti sent off for dropping Duane Vermeulen on his head in the 43rd minute and their slim hopes of progressing now rest on beating the All Blacks for the first time.
description: South Africa defeated Italy 49-3 in the Pool B encounter in Shizuoka after the Italian prop Andrea Lovotti was sent off for a blatant tip tackle just after half-time
